author: Rebecca Harman

review: I have all sorts of things that do what this does.  Sometimes I have a laptop that I plug into my TV via an HDMI cable.  I show photos and videos via Intel WiDi and wireless DLNA depending on the laptop.  I use Netflix and Vudu on my Smart TV.  Occasionally I Youtube through my Playstation 3.  I've even been known to hook up my old Samsung Infuse 4G and play games on it via Bluetooth and a PS3 controller.And yet, I still got this, because it makes it so gosh darn easy to painlessly cast Hulu Plus, Netflix, Youtube, or other media content via Plex Server.  Click on the Chrome Extension, and there it is!  What could be easier?What this really does for you is turn all your laptops, phones, and tablets into user friendly wireless remote controls, all for the cost of a night out.
author: Amazon Customer

review: NEED MORE COMPATIBLE APPS!! Works wonderfully with Netflix, though I don't have Hulu plus, but with your Chrome browser it can stream anything from your laptop screen, however you will sacrifice resolution and may experience signal lag. If you are into Netflix, it works great with my iPad, iphone & Macbook Pro. Would like it to work with HBO GO & Comcast & Time Warner on demand apps. Can't beat the price though.

review: At this time the only two programs that it supports is You Tube and Netflix. Hulu has just come on board. I thought I could stream the internet from my IPad but couldn't. The Google Chrome browser does not support Chromecast. It is easy to set up. I guess we have to wait for more apps to support Chromecast.
